DataElement.preferredName: Patient Concurrent Systemic Disease or Disorder Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether any abnormal condition prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Concurrent Systemic Disease or Disorder Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to any abnormal condition that occurs at the same time as another disease and/or affects the entire body as a medical and/or social characteristic that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Concurrent Systemic Disease or Disorder Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring or operating at the same time.:(sis-TEM-ik) Affecting the entire body.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: Occurring or operating at the same time.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Co-morbid systemic illnesses
ReferenceDocuments.description: Co-morbid systemic illnesses or other severe concurrent disease which, in the judgment of the investigator, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study or interfere significantly with the proper assessment of the safety and adverse events of the prescribed regimens

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a medical history or condition not otherwise previously specified which in the opinion of the investigator should exclude her from participating in this study

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: No significant history of a medical problem or co-morbidity that would preclude the patient from undergoing a major abdominal operation such as a history of severe congestive heart failure or active ischemic heart disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must not have non-malignant systemic disease (cardiovascular, renal, hepatic, etc.) that would preclude treatment with either of the treatment regimens

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Primary germ cell tumor, small cell carcinoma, or lymphoma

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Co-morbid systemic illnesses or other severe concurrent disease which, in the judgment of the investigator, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study or interfere significantly with the proper assessment of safety and toxicity of the prescribed regimens. Including but not limited to the following: 
-	New York Heart Association Class III or IV heart disease 
-	Recent myocardial infarction (<1 month) 
-	Uncontrolled infection 
-	Known infection with the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV/AIDS) and/or patients taking HAART as further severe immunosuppression with this regimen may occur. 
-	Infection with known chronic, active Hepatitis C 
-	Positive serology for Hepatitis B (HB) defined as a positive test for HBsAg. In addition, if negative for HBsAg but HBcAb positive (regardless of HBsAb status), a HB DNA test will be performed and if positive the subject will be excluded. 
-	Uncontrolled diabetes defined as HbA1c >=8 or fasting blood glucose >=140 mg/dL

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Co-morbid systemic illnesses or other severe concurrent disease which, in the judgment of the investigator, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study or interfere significantly with the proper assessment of safety and toxicity of the prescribed regimens

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the treating physician's opinion, does the patient have a medical condition, or currently take medications, which are felt to contraindicate safe or effective administration of the standard three drug anti-emetic regimen used in this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Other active malignancy <=3 years prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Co-morbid systemic illnesses or other concurrent disease which, in the judgment of the clinician obtaining informed consent, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study or interfere significantly with the proper assessment of safety and toxicity of the prescribed regimens

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Co-morbid illnesses or other concurrent disease which, in the judgment of the clinician obtaining informed consent, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study or interfere significantly with the proper assessment of safety and toxicity of the prescribed regimens

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of congestive heart failure, chronic renal disease, or chronic liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of a major organ allograft or condition requiring chronic immunosuppression, e.g., kidney, liver, lung, heart, bone marrow transplant, or autoimmune diseases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient be receiving concurrent immunotherapy or radiotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active septicemia, severe infection, gastrointestinal bleeding or severe gastrointestinal symptoms requiring medical or surgical therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: AECC Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has active severe infection; known infection with HIV, Hepatitis B virus, Hepatitis C virus, or severe concurrent illness?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, uncontrolled hypertension or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: AECC Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a active severe infection; known infection with HIV, Hepatitis B virus, Hepatitis C virus, or severe concurrent illness?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any co-morbid illnesses or other concurrent disease that, in the judgement of the clinician obtaining informed consent, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study or interfere significantly with the proper assessment of safety and toxicity of the prescribed regimens or prevent required follow-up?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Other autoimmune disease including but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulomastosis, Sjogren's syndrome, Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barre syndrome, multiple sclerosis, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a severe, active co-morbidity per the treating investigator's discretion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Severe
ReferenceDocuments.description: Severe, active co-morbidity

ReferenceDocuments.name: Comorbid
ReferenceDocuments.description: Severe, active co-morbidity, defined as follows: Acute bacterial or fungal infection requiring intravenous antibiotics at the time of enrollment. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease exacerbation or other respiratory illness requiring hospitalization or precluding study therapy at the time of enrollment. Known HIV positivity or acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS) based upon current CDC definition; note, however, that HIV testing is not required for entry into this protocol. The need to exclude patients with AIDS from this protocol is necessary because the treatments involved in this protocol may be significantly immunosuppressive. Active connective tissue disorders, such as lupus or scleroderma, that in the opinion of the treating physician may put the patient at high risk for radiation toxicity. Any other major medical illnesses or psychiatric impairments that in the investigator's opinion will prevent administration or completion of protocol therapy.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Other autoimmune disease including but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulomastosis, Sjogren's syndrome, Guillain-Barre syndrome, multiple sclerosis, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1802 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or current evidence of the following conditions are excluded: neuromuscular disorder with associated elevated CK (e.g. inflammatory myopathies, muscular dystrophy, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, spinal muscular atrophy), pancreatitis, retinal vein occlusion, uncontrolled HIV, or Hepatitis B/C? An exception will be made for (HIV)-infected patients on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months and for subjects with cleared HBV and HCV infections, who may enroll in the study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a severe, active co-morbidity that would preclude an elective or completion neck dissection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any other disease, metabolic dysfunction, physical examination finding, or clinical laboratory finding giving reasonable suspicion of a disease or condition that contraindicates the use of study therapy or that may affect the interpretation of the results or render the patient at high risk from treatment complications?
